alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 2:49PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mitchell, southwestern Jewell and northeastern Osborne Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 249 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Glen Elder, or near Beloit, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Glen Elder around 305 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Cawker City, Ionia and Downs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Waconda Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
